newsitem.title: FINLAND: Baltic Ice-Restrictions due for Oulu and Kemi.
newsitem.headline: Baltic Ice-Restrictions due for Oulu and Kemi.

text.p: Ice above 65 degrees north in the Gulf of Bothnia thickened and the first restrictions to navigation will come into force on December 20, the Finnish Institute of Marine Research said on Thursday.

Level ice outside the Finnish ports of Kemi, Oulu and Tornio was turning into consolidated and partly rafted form, and only ships with a deadweight above 2,000 tonnes and ice-classes I or II would be allowed from December 20, it said.
Outside Lulea in Sweden, ice had transformed into level form but there were no restrictions to shipping.
Two ice-breakers were operating in the Northern end of the Gulf of Bothnia, it said.
Ice also started to form in the eastern part of the Gulf of Finland and outside St Petersburg in Russia, it had already turned to level form. Outside Vyborg, ice was fast.

Other ports in the Gulf of Finland were still clear, with water temperatures ranging from one to four degrees Celsius in the Gulf of Bothnia and from one to five degrees in the Gulf of Finland, the institute said.
PORT TEMP ICE TYPE THICKNESS RESTRICTIONS
Oulu n/a Fast/compact 20-40 class I, II
Kemi n/a Fast/compact 10-40 class I, II.
(NOTE: New ice - forming, thin and still moving. Fast ice - not moving level flat ice. Level ice - thick flat ice. Consolidated - compact close ice)
